Description: Fragment of neck and belly of Attic black-figure neck-amphora. Neck, lotus-palmette cross. Body, tongues in compartments: winged female between two cocks, flowers sprouting in field. Purple on necking ring; on alternate tongues; on skirt and middle band of wings of central figure, and on comb, wattle, forepart of wing of cocks; and as a broadish band beneath the panel. White on arms of central figure (but apparently omitted on the feet) and as blobs on the necks of the cocks.
Curator's comments: The fragment top left does not join, but clearly belongs. The figure is probably merely decorative, not mythological: cf. BM Cat Vases, B106, 3
Bibliographic references: Vase / Catalogue of Vases in the British Museum (B125.2)
CVA British Museum 8 / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum: Great Britain 13, British Museum 8 (Pl. GB 607, 4)
Petrie 1888 / Tanis. Part II. Nebesheh (Am) and Defenneh (Tahpanhes) (pl. xxxi, 10)
Weber 2012 / Untersuchungen zur archaischen griechischen Keramik aus anderen ägyptischen Fundorten (TD 30)
